contest-event.event-date: Oct. 1, 1904 D National Championship of Great Britain (Crystal Palace) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Grand Selection: Mendelssohn's Works [arr. Godfrey] Crystal Palace (Concert Hall), Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham, County of London, England, UK Prizes: 1st: 40 Pounds plus 1000 Guinea Trophy (Total prize valued at £1,142.10s) 2nd: 30 Pounds plus Daily Telegraph cup 3rd: 20 Pounds plus 'Proteano' cornet 4th: 16 Pounds plus cornet valued at £17 175 5th: 12 Pounds plus 'Imperial Supreme Class' trombone 6th: 10 Pounds plus 'Class A' Cornet 7th: 5 Pounds plus 'Buffet' tenor horn 8th: Set of band caps valued at £10 105 9th: 24 Staff caps valued at £10 105 10th: 26 Volumes of music valued at £10 105 June 1, 2011, 12:52 p.m. Feb. 16, 2014, 9:35 p.m. 1 Hebburn Colliery Angus Holden 2 Wingates Band William Rimmer 3 Irwell Springs William Rimmer 4 Rushden Windmill Band Alexander Owen 5 Abertillery Silver L.
